intro: Phlomoides ornata, commonly known as the ornate phlomoides, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Lamiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and shrubs. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and clusters of small, tubular flowers that range in color from blue to purple. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and have a slightly hairy texture. Phlomoides ornata is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is adapted to grow in well-drained soils in full sun.
